posts.post_content:
I remember pulling this card from a 6 card pack and thinking, "Wow! Lucky!", but at the time I wasn't very into playing multi color decks, so it just stayed in my binder for awhile......never mind now! Excellent card, even if you are losing life in the process, that can be fixed if need be.  
  
I almost lost a game playing this card though b/c it was Pacified and so being unable to attack and stuff just turned that card against me. Caution to every player that uses Blood Tyrant that you should consider killing off your own Blood Tyrant if something like that happens.  
  
This card is kinda neat to combo with [Wound Reflection](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wound Reflection)
posts.html:

I almost lost a game playing this card though b/c it was Pacified and so being unable to attack and stuff just turned that card against me. Caution to every player that uses Blood Tyrant that you should consider killing off your own Blood Tyrant if something like that happens.

Rating:

posts.post_content: Gako you are correct that he is mainly a multiplayer battle, and since his effect is dealing with you too, you are incorrect about his +1/+1 gain, he truely gets +2/+2 counters every turn on a 1 on 1 battle, since he is sucking out your life in the process, if you can give him shroud after you pump him up or make him indestrucible, you have a powerful card, and also, your biggest problem is the fact that he life sucks you too, so you need to worry about how to make sure you either gain, or at least nulled the effect of this for you...i have figured out, that, if you play a 4 color deck, that excludes green, you can use recombant bliss on your opponents monsters this not only leave him wide open for attack, but you also will not worry about blodd tyrant's ability to life suck you while he gains 2 atk and power every of your upkeep, so he just gets bigger and bigger and you can make sure your oppent looses life while you dish out additional damage...
posts.html:
Gako you are correct that he is mainly a multiplayer battle, and since his effect is dealing with you too, you are incorrect about his +1/+1 gain, he truely gets +2/+2 counters every turn on a 1 on 1 battle, since he is sucking out your life in the process, if you can give him shroud after you pump him up or make him indestrucible, you have a powerful card, and also, your biggest problem is the fact that he life sucks you too, so you need to worry about how to make sure you either gain, or at least nulled the effect of this for you...i have figured out, that, if you play a 4 color deck, that excludes green, you can use recombant bliss on your opponents monsters this not only leave him wide open for attack, but you also will not worry about blodd tyrant's ability to life suck you while he gains 2 atk and power every of your upkeep, so he just gets bigger and bigger and you can make sure your oppent looses life while you dish out additional damage...

posts.post_content: Even in just 1v1 this still goes boom when it hits the table. That first ability is insanely potent, people tend to underestimate that, by the time your ready to swing with it, its a 6/6 flying trampler that gets bigger every turn: all in all not bad for just seven mana.

posts.post_content: This card is extremely fun in multiplayer. I recently played this card in a 6-player match (2v2v2) and my team dominated; during the last turn of the game, right before I used Blood Tyrant to exterminate the sole remaining opponent, he was standing tall at 48/48. I have also used it to good effect in many duels as well.

My friend mike used this card... in a 9 way battle.. with.. doubling.. season... The horror... THE HORROR!!!

great in MP, good in 1v1, I find few flaws in this card, till the opponent uses him against you.
